meanings.definition: A framework or stand on which casks or goods are placed for storage or transport.
meanings.sent1: The stillages in the warehouse held the heavy casks securely.
meanings.sent2: The workers loaded the boxes onto the stillages before shipping them out.
meanings.sent3: The stillages at the market were so full, they looked like a tower of boxes!
meanings.sent4: The stillages stood tall like guardians protecting the precious cargo.
meanings.sent5: The rusty stillages creaked under the weight of the goods, creating a symphony of metal sounds.

meanings.definition: The act of stillaging or arranging goods on a stand.
meanings.sent1: The careful stillaging of the fragile items prevented any breakage during transit.
meanings.sent2: Efficient stillaging of the products ensured quick loading onto the trucks.
meanings.sent3: The comical stillaging mix-up resulted in a tower of mismatched items!
meanings.sent4: Her precise stillaging skills were like a dance, gracefully arranging each item in place.
meanings.sent5: The stillaging process was like solving a puzzle, fitting each piece snugly on the stand.

meanings.definition: The goods or casks placed on a stand for storage or transport.
meanings.sent1: The stillages were filled with fresh produce ready for market.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse was full of stillages holding various products for distribution.
meanings.sent3: The stillages overflowed with goods, creating a colorful display.
meanings.sent4: The stillages resembled a mini city, each holding a different type of merchandise.
meanings.sent5: The stillages were like treasure chests, each holding valuable items waiting to be shipped.
